greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Polygon cycle matrices as their characteristic polynomials to form a triangular array.
comment: Modulo signs and first terms, essentially the same as A198637. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 05 2017
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Cycle Graph
formula: An(d) := Table[If[ n == m + 1 || n == m - 1, 1, If[ ( n == 1 && m == d) || (n == d && m == 1), 1, 0]], {n, 1, d}, {m, 1, d}] CharacteristicPloynomial[An[d]]->d=0 to 20
example: {1}, ( added to complete the triangle as point matrix)
mathematica: An[d_] := Table[If[ n == m + 1 || n == m - 1, 1, If[ ( n == 1 && m == d) || (n == d && m == 1), 1, 0]], {n, 1, d}, {m, 1, d}] Table[An[d], {d, 2, 20}] Table[CharacteristicPolynomial[An[d], x], {d, 2, 20}] Join[{{1}}, Table[CoefficientList[CharacteristicPolynomial[ An[d], x], x], {d, 1, 20}]] Flatten[%] Table[NSolve[CharacteristicPolynomial[An[d], x] == 0, x], {d, 2, 20}]
Flatten[{{1}, {1, -1}, {-1, 0, 1}, Table[CoefficientList[CharacteristicPolynomial[AdjacencyMatrix[CycleGraph[n]], x], x], {n, 3, 10}]}] (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 05 2017 *)
Flatten[{{1}, {1, -1}, {-1, 0, 1}, Table[CoefficientList[(-1)^n 2 (ChebyshevT[n, x/2] - 1), x], {n, 3, 10}]}] (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 05 2017 *)
xref: Cf. A198637 (essentially the same sequence). - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 06 2017
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Oct 11 2006
